bcbioSingleCell
  • Reference
  • News

Calculate Cellular Barcode Metrics Summary

Calculate Cellular Barcode Metrics Summary

calculateMetrics(object, ...)

# S4 method for dgCMatrix
calculateMetrics(object, annotable = TRUE,
  prefilter = TRUE)

# S4 method for bcbioSingleCell
calculateMetrics(object, prefilter = TRUE)

Arguments

object

Object.
...

Additional arguments.
annotable

Annotable.
prefilter

Whether to apply pre-filtering to the cellular barcodes.

Value

data.frame.

Note

This should only be performed during the initial run loading.

Examples

load(system.file("extdata/bcb.rda", package = "bcbioSingleCell"))

# bcbioSingleCell
calculateMetrics(bcb) %>% glimpse()
#> Recalculating cellular barcode metrics
#> Calculating barcode metrics
#> 500 cellular barcodes detected
#> 13 mitochondrial genes detected
#> 500 cellular barcodes passed pre-filtering (100%)
#> Observations: 500
#> Variables: 6
#> $ nUMI             <int> 3393, 5201, 1896, 2137, 2678, 5073, 1725, 1891, 32...
#> $ nGene            <int> 695, 736, 541, 545, 621, 785, 370, 525, 682, 579, ...
#> $ nCoding          <int> 2996, 4609, 1682, 1908, 2058, 4561, 1011, 1484, 28...
#> $ nMito            <int> 241, 234, 103, 83, 452, 234, 556, 246, 225, 286, 8...
#> $ log10GenesPerUMI <dbl> 0.8049617, 0.7714776, 0.8338414, 0.8217889, 0.8148...
#> $ mitoRatio        <dbl> 0.07102859, 0.04499135, 0.05432489, 0.03883949, 0....

# dgCMatrix
counts <- counts(bcb)
annotable <- annotable(bcb)
calculateMetrics(counts, annotable = annotable) %>% glimpse()
#> Calculating barcode metrics
#> 500 cellular barcodes detected
#> 13 mitochondrial genes detected
#> 500 cellular barcodes passed pre-filtering (100%)
#> Observations: 500
#> Variables: 6
#> $ nUMI             <int> 3393, 5201, 1896, 2137, 2678, 5073, 1725, 1891, 32...
#> $ nGene            <int> 695, 736, 541, 545, 621, 785, 370, 525, 682, 579, ...
#> $ nCoding          <int> 2996, 4609, 1682, 1908, 2058, 4561, 1011, 1484, 28...
#> $ nMito            <int> 241, 234, 103, 83, 452, 234, 556, 246, 225, 286, 8...
#> $ log10GenesPerUMI <dbl> 0.8049617, 0.7714776, 0.8338414, 0.8217889, 0.8148...
#> $ mitoRatio        <dbl> 0.07102859, 0.04499135, 0.05432489, 0.03883949, 0....
